required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Combined Resistance and Aerobic Exercise Training on Obesity in Adolescent Girls
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Combined Resistance and Aerobic Exercise Training on Obesity in Adolescent Girls

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study was to observe therapeutic effects of combined resistance and aerobic exercise training (CRAE) on hyperinsulemia in obese adolescent girls. Forty obese adolescent girls (14Â±1 years) participated in this study. The participants were randomly separated into two groups; no-exercise group (n=20) and exercise group (n=20). The exercise group performed 12 weeks of CRAE.

primary_outcome.description: Height was measured before and after 12 weeks.
Weight was measured before and after 12 weeks.
BMI was calculated with weight and height before and after 12 weeks.
Body fat was measured before and after 12 weeks.
Lean body mass was measured before and after 12 weeks.
Waist circumference was measured before and after 12 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Glucose Levels in Millimole Per Liter
primary_outcome.description: Glucose levels were measured before and after 12 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Insulin Levels in Micro Unit Per Milliliter
primary_outcome.description: Insulin levels were measured before and after 12 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Homeostasis Model Assessment of Insulin Resistance (HOMA-IR)
primary_outcome.description: Homeostasis model assessment of Insulin Resistance (HOMA-IR) was calculated before and after 12 weeks

primary_outcome.measure: Leptin Levels in Nano Grams Per Milliliter
primary_outcome.description: Leptin levels were measured before and after 12 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Adiponectin Levels in Micro Grams Per Milliliter
primary_outcome.description: Adiponectin levels were measured before and after the training.

secondary_outcome.description: Volume of maximal oxygen consumption (VO2max) was determined using a maximal treadmill test before and after 12 weeks.
Brachial-ankle Pulse Wave Velocity (m/s) was measured using applanation tonometry before and after 12 weeks.
Systolic blood pressure was measured before and after 12 weeks.
Diastolic blood pressure was measured before and after 12 weeks.

arm_group.description: Twenty obese adolescent girls. This arm did not perform any exercise training for 12 weeks. Caloric intake: 1921.7 kcal/day
Twenty obese adolescent girls. This arm performed combined exercise training 5 times a week for 12 weeks. Caloric intake: 1921.7 kcal/day

intervention.description: The combined exercise training were consisted with 5 minutes of warm-up, 20 minutes of resistant band exercises (Upper: seated rows, biceps curl, shoulder flexion, elbow flexion, pushup; Lower: hip flexion, hip extension, calf raise, leg press, squat), 30 minutes of treadmill walking, and 5 minutes of cool-down. Intensity of the training was gradually increased from 40-50% heart rate reserve in 1-4 weeks to 60-70% HRR in 9-12 weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Obese with Hyperinsulinemia
- Obese with Abdominal obesity
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hypertension
- Pregnancy
- Chronic diseases
- Weight loss diet within the last 6 months

group.title: No Exercise (CON)
group.description: Twenty obese adolescent girls. This arm did not perform any exercise training for 12 weeks. Caloric intake: 1921.7 kcal/day (n = 20)

group.title: Exercise (EX)
group.description: Twenty obese adolescent girls. This arm performed combined exercise training 5 times a week for 12 weeks. Caloric intake: 1921.7 kcal/day (n = 20) Combined Exercise Training: The combined exercise training were consisted with 5 minutes of warm-up, 20 minutes of resistant band exercises (Upper: seated rows, biceps curl, shoulder flexion, elbow flexion, pushup; Lower: hip flexion, hip extension, calf raise, leg press, squat), 30 minutes of treadmill walking, and 5 minutes of cool-down. Intensity of the training was gradually increased from 40-50% heart rate reserve in 1-4 weeks to 60-70% HRR in 9-12 weeks.

group.title: No Exercise (CON)
group.description: Twenty obese adolescent girls. This arm did not perform any exercise training for 12 weeks. Caloric intake: 1921.7 kcal/day

group.title: Exercise (EX)
group.description: Twenty obese adolescent girls. This arm performed combined exercise training 5 times a week for 12 weeks. Caloric intake: 1921.7 kcal/day Combined Exercise Training: The combined exercise training were consisted with 5 minutes of warm-up, 20 minutes of resistant band exercises (Upper: seated rows, biceps curl, shoulder flexion, elbow flexion, pushup; Lower: hip flexion, hip extension, calf raise, leg press, squat), 30 minutes of treadmill walking, and 5 minutes of cool-down. Intensity of the training was gradually increased from 40-50% heart rate reserve in 1-4 weeks to 60-70% HRR in 9-12 weeks.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Homeostasis Model Assessment of Insulin Resistance (HOMA-IR)
measure.description: HOMA-IR calculation: fasting insulin (uU/L) x fasting glucose (nmol/L)/22.5 Lower values for this measurement are favorable.

measure.title: Volume of maximal oxygen consumption (VO2max)
measure.description: Volume of maximal oxygen consumption (VO2max) was determined using a maximal treadmill test.

measure.title: Arterial stiffness
measure.description: Brachial-ankle Pulse Wave Velocity (m/s) was measured using applanation tonometry.

outcome.description: Height was measured before and after 12 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

point_of_contact.organization: The University of Nebraska at Omaha
